item.title: Allu Arjun's Hyderabad house vandalised by protesters demanding money for Pushpa 2 stampede victim's family - Hindustan Times
item.description:
Protesters Vandalise Allu Arjun's Hyderabad Home Demanding Compensation for Stampede Victim

Date: December 22, 2024
Source: Hindustan Times

Protesters from the OU JAC vandalised Allu Arjun's house, demanding he pay ₹1 crore to the family of a stampede victim during the Pushpa 2 premiere.

  • Protesters vandalised Arjun's home in Hyderabad, throwing stones and breaking flower pots.
  • The demands were linked to the tragic death of a woman during the Pushpa 2 premiere.
  • The incident led to several arrests, with the police responding to the vandalism.
“We demand that Allu Arjun take care of the late Revathi’s family... We will not let you go anywhere if these demands aren’t met.”

The incident highlights the ongoing tensions surrounding the Pushpa 2 premiere and raises questions about celebrity accountability.

item.title: What Accenture’s hiring spree means for Indian IT industry | Company Business News - Mint
item.description:
What Accenture’s hiring spree means for Indian IT industry

Publication Date: Not specified   |   Source: Live Mint

Accenture Plc’s renewed hiring—it added 49,000 people globally in the last six months—suggests technology services companies expect much better growth in the coming months. This hiring spree paints a positive outlook for homegrown IT services companies that are expected to record better growth in the coming quarters, according to analysts.

  • Accenture added 49,000 employees globally in six months.
  • Analysts suggest better growth prospects for technology services companies.
  • The hiring trend indicates a sanguine outlook for the Indian IT sector.
“Analysts indicated that the move reflects expectations of better growth in the tech sector.”

The hiring activity from Accenture signifies optimism in the tech industry, particularly benefitting Indian IT services firms, leading to an anticipated acceleration in growth.

item.title: Tomotoes Thrown, Protest Outside Allu Arjun's Home Over Stampede Death - NDTV
item.description:
Protest Erupts Outside Allu Arjun's Home Following Stampede Tragedy

Date: December 24, 2024 | Source: NDTV

A large protest occurred outside the residence of film actor Allu Arjun, ignited by a recent stampede at a movie premiere that resulted in a tragic death.

  • The protest was led by individuals claiming to be students from Osmania University.
  • During the protest, demonstrators threw tomatoes and damaged property.
  • The stampede incident happened on December 4 at Sandhya Theatre during the premiere of 'Pushpa 2'.
  • A woman died in the incident, and her eight-year-old son remains hospitalized in a coma.
  • Criticism has been directed at Allu Arjun for allegedly disregarding police orders at the event, which may have contributed to the chaos.
“He had even waved from his car's sun-roof on his way in and out, holding a roadshow of sorts and triggering a stampede-like situation.” - Chief Minister Revanth Reddy

The protest underscores public outrage over the handling of the premiere and the resulting tragedy, highlighting a need for accountability in event management.

item.title: Snack Food Epigamia Founder Rohan Mirchandani Dies Of Cardiac Arrest At 41 - NDTV
item.description:
Rohan Mirchandani, Founder of Snack Food Brand Epigamia, Passes Away at 41

Publication Date: December 24, 2024 | Source: NDTV

Rohan Mirchandani, the founder of the healthy snack foods company Epigamia, has died from cardiac arrest at the age of 41. The company has requested privacy for his family during this time.

  • Mirchandani was the founder of Drums Food International Pvt Ltd, which operates the Epigamia brand.
  • The senior leadership team, including COO Ankur Goel and director Uday Thakker, will continue to manage the company's operations.
  • The board of directors and Mirchandani’s family are supportive of the leadership during this period.
  • Colleagues describe him as a mentor and leader whose vision will guide the company moving forward.
  • Epigamia is known for its commitment to healthy snacks, including its yoghurt and juices made from real fruit.
“Rohan was our mentor, friend, and leader. His vision and values will continue to guide us.” - Ankur Goel and Uday Thakker

Mirchandani's legacy will be cherished by all who knew him and his contributions to the industry are recognized as significant.

item.title: Colleen Hoover BREAKS Silence On Blake Lively's Claims Against Justin: 'You Have Been Nothing But...' - News18
item.description:
Colleen Hoover BREAKS Silence On Blake Lively's Claims Against Justin: 'You Have Been Nothing But...'

Date: December 22, 2024 Source: News

Colleen Hoover has publicly supported Blake Lively following allegations of sexual harassment made against Justin Baldoni, the director and co-star of their film, It Ends With Us.

  • Blake Lively accused Justin Baldoni of creating a hostile work environment and filed a lawsuit against him.
  • Colleen Hoover reacted on Instagram, praising Blake's character and honesty.
  • The lawsuit includes specific prohibitions regarding Justin's conduct during the production of the film.
  • Justin Baldoni's representatives have denied the allegations, describing them as categorically false.
"Thank you for being exactly the human that you are. Never change. Never wilt." - Colleen Hoover

This situation highlights ongoing discussions about workplace behavior in the film industry, particularly regarding issues of harassment and support among peers.

item.title: Ursids: How and when to see the last peak meteor shower of 2024 - HT Tech
item.description:
Ursids: How and when to see the last peak meteor shower of 2024

Publication Date: December 2024
Source: Tech Hindustan Times

The Ursid meteor shower is set to light up the skies from December 17 to December 24, peaking around December 23. This annual event provides an opportunity for skywatchers to observe the meteors.

Best Viewing Times for the Ursids

Despite some challenges, the best viewing for the Ursids will occur between midnight and early morning, particularly from 4 to 5 AM ET on December 23. Up to 10 meteors can be seen per hour without the need for special equipment.

Tips for Viewing the Meteor Shower

To increase your chances of spotting meteors, face north with the moon behind you and lie back to get a full view of the sky. It's advisable to stay outside for at least an hour to adjust your eyes to the darkness.

Don't Miss the Quadrantids

If you miss the Ursids, the Quadrantid meteor shower will follow, starting on December 26 and peaking on January 3.

item.title: 8 simple ways to manage your blood pressure during winter - The Times of India
item.description:
8 Simple Ways to Manage Your Blood Pressure During Winter

Publication Date: Not provided Source: Not provided

As winter approaches, many individuals may experience elevated blood pressure due to cold temperatures and increased salt consumption. This article outlines eight ways to manage blood pressure effectively during the winter months.

  • Keep yourself warm by dressing in layers and maintaining a warm home environment.
  • Stay active through regular exercise, even in colder conditions.
  • Adopt a heart-healthy diet rich in fruits, vegetables, and whole grains.
  • Limit salt intake to reduce sodium consumption.
  • Include fruits in your daily diet, particularly potassium-rich options.
  • Practice deep breathing exercises to manage stress.
  • Prioritize good sleep hygiene for overall health.
  • Monitor your blood pressure regularly to manage hypertension effectively.
“By following these eight tips this winter, you can effectively manage your blood pressure and maintain overall health during the colder months.”

In conclusion, maintaining blood pressure levels during winter is crucial, and implementing these strategies can contribute to overall cardiovascular health.

item.title: Baby John Box Office Day 1 Advance Booking (3 Days To Go): Sells Over 5,200 Tickets In 7 Hours, Varun Dhawan Starrer Aims For A Good Start - Koimoi
item.description:
Baby John Box Office Day 1 Advance Booking (3 Days To Go)

Publication Date & Source: December 2024, Koimoi

Baby John is just three days away from hitting the big screen. Varun Dhawan takes on a full-fledged action role for the first time, and anticipation is building. However, it faces tough competition from Pushpa 2. Here’s a detailed advance booking report for day 1!

  • The film has sold around 5,300 tickets by 5 PM IST, grossing 18.70 lakh+ through advance bookings.
  • The film's pre-sales started at 10 AM IST.
  • With around 2,500 shows currently scheduled, more are expected to be added soon, potentially boosting ticket sales.
  • Varun Dhawan's last release, Bhediya, had a day 1 advance booking of 1.85 crore gross.
“The film should ideally look to close its pre-sales at 6-7 crores.”

Baby John is gearing up for its release amid high expectations. The success in advance bookings will be crucial for its box office performance.

item.title: Govt to infuse ₹500 cr in IFCI to improve its financial health | Company Business News - Mint
item.description:
Government to Invest ₹500 Crore in IFCI for Financial Revitalization

Date: December 22, 2024

Source: PTI

The Indian government has announced a capital infusion of ₹500 crore into the state-owned Industrial Finance Corporation of India (IFCI) to enhance its financial condition.

  • The capital infusion aims to improve IFCI's financial health amidst proposed restructuring.
  • The government's stake in IFCI will increase from 71.72% with this infusion.
  • This was part of the first Supplementary Demand for Grants for 2024-25 approved by the Lok Sabha.
  • IFCI reported a loss of ₹22 crore in Q2 and ₹170 crore in the first half of FY24.
  • Plans include the consolidation of IFCI with several group companies, including StockHolding Corporation of India Ltd.
"The consolidation of IFCI Group entails merger/amalgamation of various subsidiaries under IFCI Ltd."

The government's intervention is expected to stabilize the corporation and aid in its restructuring efforts.

item.title: PM Narendra Modi receives Kuwait's highest honour, 20th international award by a country - Hindustan Times
item.description:
PM Narendra Modi receives Kuwait's highest honour, 20th international award by a country

Date: Dec 22, 2024 Source: Hindustan Times

Prime Minister Narendra Modi was awarded Kuwait's prestigious ‘The Order of Mubarak Al Kabeer’, making it his 20th international award from a country.

  • This honor is a knighthood order given to Heads of State, foreign Sovereigns, and members of foreign royal families.
  • PM Modi dedicated this honour to the people of India and the friendship between India and Kuwait.
  • This award has previously been given to notable figures such as Bill Clinton and Prince Charles.
  • Modi also received Guyana's highest award and the Dominica Award of Honour recently.
  • The Prime Minister received a ceremonial guard of honour during his visit to Kuwait.
“I am honoured to be conferred the Mubarak Al-Kabeer Order by His Highness the Amir of Kuwait...” - PM Modi

This recognition underscores the strengthening ties between India and Kuwait and highlights PM Modi's growing global stature.

item.title: ‘Suicidal Empathy’: Elon Musk Reacts To Reports On Germany Refusing To Extradite Saudi Suspect - News18
item.description:
‘Suicidal Empathy’: Elon Musk Reacts To Reports On Germany Refusing To Extradite Saudi Suspect

Date: December 22, 2024 | Source: News18

Elon Musk has reacted to Germany's refusal to extradite a Saudi national suspected in a deadly attack at a Christmas market, which resulted in the death of five people.

  • Musk criticized German Chancellor Olaf Scholz, calling for his resignation due to the attack.
  • The attack occurred in Magdeburg when a car plowed into a crowd, injuring over 60 individuals.
  • The Saudi suspect, Taleb A, is under investigation for multiple serious charges including murder.
  • Musk described Germany's stance as 'suicidal empathy', reflecting frustrations with human rights considerations in regard to the extradition.
  • Germany's Christmas market security has tightened following the incident, echoing past threats from extremist attacks.
"Europe must walk away from its ‘suicidal empathy' policy." — Visegrád 24 (@visegrad24)

This incident has sparked a broader discussion on security measures at public events in Germany, as previous attacks have raised concerns about safety at Christmas markets.

item.title: Team India nets ft. epic one-liners from Rohit Sharma, Jasprit Bumrah and Rishabh Pant - The Times of India
item.description:
Team India nets ft. epic one-liners from Rohit Sharma, Jasprit Bumrah and Rishabh Pant

Publication Date: MELBOURNE

Source: Times of India

The Indian cricket team showcased their fun side during a nets session in Melbourne, highlighted by witty exchanges between players such as Rohit Sharma, Jasprit Bumrah, and Rishabh Pant. Their humorous banter not only entertained themselves but also engaged the spectators present.

  • Rohit Sharma impressed with his quick reflexes, pulling a bouncer from Mohammed Siraj and sharing his insight on it.
  • Bumrah playfully interacted with the openers, offering words of encouragement while putting pressure on them.
  • The atmosphere was jovial, with players like Rohit and Jasprit keeping the mood light with humorous comments.
  • Rishabh Pant joined in the fun, humorously commenting on the challenges presented by Bumrah during practice.
  • The team displayed camaraderie and positivity, making for a lively practice session at the Melbourne Cricket Ground.
“Na batsman [batter] ko match mai ready hone dete ho, na practice mein,” - Rishabh Pant commenting on the intensity of practices.

Overall, India's nets session was a mix of hard work and laughter, setting a positive tone for their upcoming matches.

item.title: Red carpet for foreign arrivals, make ’India inevitable’: Hospitality sector’s New Year resolution - Mint
item.description:
Red carpet for foreign arrivals, make ’India inevitable’: Hospitality sector’s New Year resolution

Date: December 22, 2023 | Source: PTI

The Indian hospitality industry is poised for a significant rebound as it aims to surpass pre-Covid international tourist arrivals and contribute $1 trillion to the economy by 2047. Industry leaders are calling for governmental support to facilitate this growth.

  • The hospitality sector expects to welcome over 30 million foreign tourists by 2028.
  • Projected growth of domestic tourism by 15-20% driven by initiatives like 'Dekho Apna Desh'.
  • Hotel occupancy rates are predicted to rise to 75% or higher.
  • Industry leaders are advocating for hotels to be classified as infrastructure for better support and financing.
  • The total contribution of the sector to India's GDP could grow by 10-12%.
“The hospitality sector's multiplier effect on the economy surpasses that of manufacturing and agriculture.” - KB Kachru, HAI President

In conclusion, the Indian hospitality sector is on an optimistic trajectory towards recovery and growth, reliant on supportive policies and infrastructure investment from the government.

item.description:

item.title: Rohit Sharma uses baseball bat in unique training drill as pressure builds on out-of-form India captain before MCG Test - Hindustan Times
item.description:
Rohit Sharma uses baseball bat in unique training drill as pressure builds on out-of-form India captain before MCG Test

Date: Dec 22, 2024 | Source: Hindustan Times

Indian captain Rohit Sharma engaged in a unique training drill using a baseball bat to enhance his batting technique in preparation for the crucial Boxing Day Test against Australia.

  • Rohit has struggled with form, scoring only 19 runs in three innings of the series.
  • The Test series is tied at 1-1, making the upcoming match crucial for India.
  • Rohit was seen with an ice pack on his knee during training, raising concerns about potential injury.
  • His struggles extend beyond this series, with only 153 runs in 13 innings since mid-2024.
  • Virat Kohli's performance is also under scrutiny as he aims for a comeback in the upcoming Test.
“As the Indian skipper, Rohit’s form is critical, and he knows that he needs to find his rhythm to help steer his team to victory.”

In conclusion, with pressure mounting, Rohit Sharma’s unique training methods highlight his determination to return to form and lead his team effectively in the upcoming Test.

item.title: Realme 14 Pro confirmed to feature colour changing design, Launch in India soon - Kalinga TV
item.description:
Realme 14 Pro confirmed to feature colour changing design, Launch in India soon

Publication Date: N/A Source: Kalinga TV

Realme is preparing to launch the Realme 14 Pro 5G series in India soon, featuring a groundbreaking colour-changing design.

  • The series will include two models: Realme 14 Pro and Realme 14 Pro+.
  • The Realme 14 Pro will have a unique back panel that changes color when exposed to water.
  • The smartphone has obtained IP66, IP68, and IP69 ratings for durability against dust and water.
  • It features a circular camera module with a robust metal ring housing three sensors and LED flashlights.
  • The colour-changing technology was developed in collaboration with Nordic industrial design studio Valeur Designers.
  • The global launch is set for January 2025, with the exact date to be confirmed.
The Realme 14 Pro will become the world’s first colour-changing smartphone.

The upcoming launch of the Realme 14 Pro series highlights innovative design in mobile technology.

item.title: With decks cleared for Nitish leadership for 2025 polls, an NDA refrain: ‘Bihar is not Maharashtra’ - The Indian Express
item.description:
Nitish Kumar to Lead NDA in 2025 Bihar Assembly Elections

Date: October 2023
Source: Indian Express

In a recent development, the NDA in Bihar has confirmed that Chief Minister Nitish Kumar will lead the coalition for the upcoming Assembly polls scheduled for October-November 2025, dismissing any speculation about changes in leadership.

  • The NDA constituents reaffirm Nitish Kumar's leadership amid discussions of leadership dynamics.
  • Bihar BJP president Dilip Jaiswal emphasized that Nitish will continue to lead in the elections.
  • The NDA plans a comprehensive campaign with Nitish Kumar addressing joint meetings across various districts, starting in January.
  • Other NDA partners in Bihar include Jitan Ram Manjhi’s Hindustani Awam Morcha and Chirag Paswan’s LJP (RV).
  • Historical context shows Nitish's significant role in Bihar politics dating back to 2000.
“The BJP knows that Nitish is indispensable for the NDA... The BJP can only silently wait for him to walk into the sunset,” a state BJP leader remarked.

This clarification from the NDA partners underlines the stability of Nitish Kumar's leadership as they gear up for the elections, marking his enduring influence in Bihar politics.

item.title: Heart muscle can regenerate after failure in some patients with artificial hearts: Study - Mathrubhumi English
item.description:
Heart Muscle Can Regenerate After Failure in Some Patients with Artificial Hearts: Study

Published on: Date Unknown | Source: Mathrubhumi

A groundbreaking study reveals that certain patients with artificial hearts, particularly those using left ventricular assist devices (LVADs), can regenerate heart muscle, potentially offering new hope for treating heart failure.

  • The research, co-led by the University of Arizona, suggests heart cells can regenerate at a rate over six times higher than in healthy individuals.
  • Current treatments for heart failure include medications, transplants, or LVADs, as there is no known cure.
  • Dr. Hesham Sadek noted that, unlike skeletal muscle, heart muscle does not typically regenerate after an injury.
  • The study raises implications for future therapies targeting mechanisms of heart muscle regeneration.
  • This collaborative research was published in the journal Circulation.
“This is the strongest evidence we have so far that human heart muscle cells can actually regenerate.” - Dr. Hesham Sadek

The findings underscore the potential for innovative therapies that could transform treatment for heart failure and enhance understanding of cardiology.

item.title: ‘Tried to prevent collision’: Trucker booked for Bengaluru accident that killed 6 in SUV blames another vehicle - The Indian Express
item.description:
‘Tried to prevent collision’: Trucker booked for Bengaluru accident that killed 6 in SUV blames another vehicle

Date: Saturday

Source: Local News

The Bengaluru rural district police are investigating a tragic accident involving a container truck and an SUV that resulted in the deaths of six family members, including a software company CEO and his two children.

Key Points:

  • The accident occurred near Nelamangala when a truck's container fell onto the Volvo XC90 occupied by Chandram Yegapagol and his family.
  • The truck driver, Arif, claims a blue car abruptly braked, causing him to lose control.
  • Police have secured CCTV footage that seems to support the truck driver's statement.
  • All six victims, including Yegapagol’s wife and children, were on their way to their native village.
  • The family was well-prepared for safety, with Yegapagol recently purchasing the Volvo for its safety features.
  • The incident has garnered significant local attention due to the family’s prominence and their tragic loss.
“Safety was a priority for him. He checked many vehicles before deciding on the Volvo.” - Umesh Murudi, relative

This devastating event highlights the risks associated with road traffic and the importance of driver awareness. The investigation continues as authorities search for the driver of the blue car involved.

item.title: Turkey: Four killed after helicopter crashes into hospital - Hindustan Times
item.description:
Helicopter Crash in Turkey Claims Four Lives

December 22, 2024; Source: Hindustan Times

At least four people were killed on Sunday after a helicopter crashed into a hospital in southwestern Turkey during takeoff amidst poor visibility.

  • The helicopter collided with the fourth story of a hospital in Mugla.
  • The victims included two pilots, a doctor, and a hospital employee.
  • This incident follows a previous mid-air collision of military helicopters on December 9, which resulted in six fatalities.
“The helicopter took off amid poor visibility from the roof of Mugla's hospital en route to the city of Antalya.”

This tragic event underscores the dangers associated with aviation in poor weather conditions and has prompted further investigations into the incidents.

item.title: 'Swami, I've waited lifetimes for you': Woman dresses up as bride, confesses to loving Ranveer Allahbadia - Hindustan Times
item.description:
Woman Dresses as Bride, Confesses Love for YouTuber Ranveer Allahbadia

Date: Dec 22, 2024 Source: Hindustan Times

Rohini Arju, a fan of YouTuber Ranveer Allahbadia, expressed her love in a dramatic fashion by dressing as a bride and performing rituals with his photo during Karwa Chauth.

  • Rohini has shared videos on Instagram worshipping a photo of Ranveer Allahbadia, also known as BeerBiceps.
  • She has stated that she would never marry anyone except for him.
  • Her love declaration includes a tattoo of his name on her shoulder and bridal mehendi with “Ranveer” written on it.
  • Reports indicate that her posts have received mixed reactions, with some calling them creepy or problematic.
  • She expressed deep emotion, stating, “Swami, I’ve waited lifetimes for you.”
“Many people may mock me and make fun of me for this... But, I love you beyond time, space, and eternity, Ranveer Allahbadia.”

This story showcases the intense devotion and fandom some individuals can exhibit, raising questions about the boundaries of admiration and obsession.

item.title: OTTplay and BSNL aim to connect and entertain BSNL subscribers through strategic partnership in Pondicherry - Mint
item.description:
BSNL Launches Free Intranet TV and Wi-Fi Roaming Services in Puducherry

Date: 22 December 2025 | Source: Live Mint

Bharat Sanchar Nigam Limited (BSNL) has unveiled three innovative services in Puducherry aimed at enhancing connectivity and entertainment for users. This includes mobile access to over 300 live TV channels for free, national Wi-Fi roaming in rural areas, and a fibre-based intranet TV service.

Key Points:

  • Introduction of Intranet TV (BiTV) allowing free access to 300+ live channels via mobile.
  • Launch of National Wi-Fi Roaming enabling seamless internet access for both BSNL and non-BSNL users in rural areas.
  • Debut of Intranet Fibre-based TV (IFTV) providing 500+ channels free of charge to FTTH customers.
“With BiTV, we are giving every customer the power to access entertainment on the go, ‘anytime, anywhere,’ free of cost.” - Robert Ravi, BSNL CMD.

BSNL’s initiatives reflect its commitment to digital inclusion, promising to redefine how Indians experience connectivity and entertainment.

item.title: OTTplay and BSNL aim to connect and entertain BSNL subscribers through strategic partnership in Pondicherry | Company Business News - Mint
item.description:
OTTplay and BSNL Join Forces to Enhance Entertainment Access for Subscribers in Pondicherry

Date: December 22, 2025 | Source: Live Mint

OTTplay, India’s leading OTT super app, partners with BSNL to provide digital entertainment to BSNL subscribers, offering access to over 300 live TV channels and premium content.

  • Partnership aims to provide free access to live TV channels for BSNL subscribers in Puducherry.
  • Integration of BSNL's fibre-to-the-home (FTTH) network enhances streaming quality and access to blockbuster movies and web series.
  • Other offerings include 50+ channels and 1000+ PayTV titles at no additional cost for BSNL subscribers.
  • The initiative promotes digital inclusion across rural and urban areas.
“With new BiTV innovation, we’re proud to bring world-class entertainment to BSNL customers across India.” - Avinash Mudaliar, Co-founder and CEO, OTTplay

This partnership combines BSNL’s extensive network with OTTplay’s content, seeking to revolutionize entertainment access for all BSNL subscribers.

item.title: Four killed as Helicopter crashes into Turkish hospital amid thick fog - The Times of India
item.description:
Four killed as Helicopter crashes into Turkish hospital amid thick fog

Publication Date: [Insert Date Here]

Source: [Insert Source Here]

A helicopter tragically crashed into a hospital in Turkey due to thick fog, resulting in the deaths of four individuals. The incident has raised concerns about aviation safety during adverse weather conditions.

  • The crash occurred amidst heavy fog, limiting visibility for pilots.
  • The helicopter was reportedly on its way to transport a patient to another facility.
  • Officials have initiated an investigation into the cause of the crash.
“This is a tragic event that highlights the dangers of flying under poor weather conditions.”

This incident emphasizes the need for stricter safety measures in aviation, particularly during adverse weather.

item.title: What's Getting Cheaper And Costlier After GST Council Meeting? Check Full List - News18
item.description:
What's Getting Cheaper And Costlier After GST Council Meeting? Check Full List

Date: December 22, 2024 Source: News18

The GST Council's 55th meeting led by Finance Minister Nirmala Sitharaman reviewed and made significant changes to GST rates, impacting various goods and services.

  • Reduction in GST on Fortified Rice Kernel (FRK) to 5% to enhance affordability.
  • Full GST exemption on gene therapy to improve accessibility.
  • Exemption for contributions to the Motor Vehicle Accident Fund from GST.
  • No GST on transactions involving vouchers.
  • No GST on penal charges levied by banks and NBFCs for non-compliance.
  • Reduction in pre-deposit for appeals regarding penalty amounts.
“The GST Council aims to provide relief to individuals and streamline compliance,” remarked Finance Minister Nirmala Sitharaman.

This meeting signifies an effort to enhance the economic landscape by adjusting tax rates strategically to support various sectors.

item.title: Narendra Modi in Kuwait: PM receives guard of honour on Day 2, lauds India's ties with Gulf nation - Hindustan Times
item.description:
Narendra Modi in Kuwait: PM receives guard of honour on Day 2, lauds India's ties with Gulf nation

Publication Date: Recent

Source: Hindustan Times

Prime Minister Narendra Modi received a ceremonial welcome and guard of honour during his official visit to Kuwait, marking the first visit by an Indian PM to the country in 43 years. His discussions with Kuwaiti officials emphasized the bilateral ties, economic partnerships, and cultural connections between the two nations.

  • Modi's visit was at the invitation of the Emir of Kuwait, Sheikh Meshal Al-Ahmad Al-Jaber Al-Sabah.
  • He met with the Indian diaspora and participated in cultural and business discussions.
  • Trade and commerce highlighted as key aspects of India-Kuwait relations.
  • Modi emphasized India's growing economy and the presence of 'Made in India' products in Kuwait.
  • He discussed the importance of the Indian community in Kuwait and its contributions to bilateral relations.
“Overall, the bilateral ties are progressing well and if I could say, scaling new heights.” - PM Narendra Modi

The visit aims to strengthen historical ties and explore opportunities for future cooperation in trade, investment, and cultural exchange.
